In fact, future change in the circulation over the Mediterranean exhibits a rather inhomogeneous spatial pattern. Previous study has proposed that the descending motion over the Western Mediterranean (WM, 0–20° E, 25°–45° N) is expected to strengthen, whereas that over the Eastern Mediterranean (EM) is anticipated to weaken in the future
30 . The descending motion changes over the Mediterranean has been attributed to the local circulation change as well as monsoon induced heating
30 . The latter is the main source according to the monsoon–desert theory
12 . However, except for the SASM-related forcing, there exist various forcing mechanisms such as the EASM, West African monsoon, and Atlantic Intertropical Convergence Zone. Therefore, the whole picture of physical processes causing the circulation changes over the Mediterranean needs to be investigated.
